item.title: Cellular Netbooks Are Downright Cheap
item.description:
Do you spend most of your computing time on the go? If so, a computer designed for mobility might be perfect for you, like one of the new netbooks with built-in 3G cellular internet access. You might be thinking laptops aren’t that bulky and work fine at a coffee shop. That’s true. A laptop with a wireless modem aircard would be comparable to a netbook in functionality. However, laptops are heavier and often carry unnecessary extras...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/cellular-netbooks-are-downright-cheap/

item.title: How Aircards Work For Mobile Computing
item.description:
Internet access via broadband has become a standard requirement for almost all businesses and home offices. Individuals can easily find and afford DSL and Cable Internet. Businesses, on the other hand, often opt for T1 lines, DS3 bandwidth, and Ethernet connections. However, challenges arise when venturing beyond the confines of a traditional workspace. Without WiFi hotspots, staying connected becomes difficult. How can tasks such as delivering presentations, accessing inventory, or entering orders at a client’s office be accomplished if they necessitate a broadband connection?..
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/how-aircards-work-for-mobile-computing/

item.title: Your Smartphone Business Office
item.description:
Microelectronics have brought us the era of the portable office, enabling employees and independent professionals to work from anywhere. This freedom is thanks to the smartphone, which combines a cell phone and a computer. While each uses its own wireless network, they work together to support your work. Voice communication happens through the cell phone. Many professionals use Bluetooth headsets, not just to free their hands but also to view the screen and utilize apps while talking...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/your-smartphone-business-office/

item.title: Amazon's Kindle Tells Bedtime Stories
item.description:
Struggling to sleep during a long car ride? Imagine listening to a soothing bedtime story. Facing a day-long drive? Use that time wisely by enjoying audiobooks of popular business titles. This might sound like an advertisement for audiotapes or CDs, but those are outdated. What you need is digitized content, transformed from written text into spoken words, and played on a device the size of a paperback book. What you need is the new Amazon Kindle 2...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/amazons-kindle-tells-bedtime-stories/
